Pop Mook

Hello there. My name is Cory. I'm a UX designer by day and am learning to build video games at night. I will document my progress on this blog.

Pixel Art

Nov 28, 2017

So I have very little experience with game development, and even less experience with 3D modeling. I’ve gone through a handful of tutorials (Brackeys - thank you!!!!). I started to look into Blender tutorials but quickly became overwhelmed and dishearten. Then, a few days ago I decided to look at Brackey’s 2D Platformer course. I was once again energized. I may know nothing about 3D, but I’ve used Photoshop for years, and am confident I can make my own mediocre graphics!

BTW, I’m embarrassed to admit this, but I never put together that a “platformer” was a game where you run across platforms. The more you know.

I started by drawing a pixel version of my old, crappy car. My kids have named her “Field”.

I dropped it in my 2D Platformer tutorial and quickly realized that cars behave weird when they’re replacing characters. Oh well, it was a fun experiment.

So instead of a car, I drew up a pixel version of my kids. If you don’t have kids, you may think this is super lame, but I don’t care. You have free time and expendable income. I have two rad, funny, kids who may be the only ones that play this game.

Until next time.
